poem:
### Quiet Defiance

Newsprint ink smears,  
a judge's gavel echoes —  
muffled denials,  
shadows of borders  
draw lines in doubt.  
In the crisp morning air,  
a voice shouts,  
"I don't care" —  
it drifts above walls,  
into open skies.  
Voices demand closure,  
in these cracks,  
paper thins,  
souls wait,  
between verdicts  
and whispered winds.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "White House denies violating judge’s order with Venezuela deportations The White House has denied allegations that it engaged in a “a blatant violation” of a judge’s order by deporting about 250 Venezuelan alleged gang members to El Salvador on Saturday, with the US border czar appearing to contradict the denial on Monday by declaring: “I don’t care what the judges think.” The US district judge James E Boasberg has scheduled a hearing for Monday afternoon". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
